website_summaries.verdict: Pocket is the easiest, fastest Android tool for clipping Web content for offline consumption, on a variety of devices and platforms. Also handy for taking stock of items you come across online.

customer_reviews.title: All works as it should
customer_reviews.text: Excellent app, and it works! Once I figured where to click to save a webpage to Pocket (the ... icon in the top right of any Silk page, and then the "Send to" option), it's quick and easy to save pages. Gives a cleaner read than the Silk's Reading View which often saves ads as well and doesn't deal well with sites using frames and popups, as well as making stuff available to other devices. Works offline, too, though obviously the Kindle with the app open needs to be connected to the internet for long enough to download new pages, which took a few seconds to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Jones

customer_reviews.title: A good idea that doesn't work offline.
customer_reviews.text: I understood and want what this app promises, but alas it doesn't delivery. Before you read this offline you need to contact to the internet to get the c content you saved, which makes sense. But what doesn't make sense is connecting to the internet again for the same content you checked would be available offline before you disconnected the WiFi. Defeats the point of reading offline if you need to go online to reload it. Apart from that flaw it looks good, just what you might like to read offline material if it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Pocket is simply perfect
customer_reviews.text: You can save articles - anything in fact - for reading later. The content is saved in a format for easy reading but you can go back to the original at any time. It is quick and easy to use. Syncs straight away across devices. Very clear to read on the screen and you can organise what you've saved in a way that suits you. You can share what you've saved if you want to. I agree with all the other 5* reviews. I have only just started using this App but understand why millions of people use it. I LOVE it. It's brilliant and it's free.
customer_reviews.author: Beverley

The biggest drawback is you can't download a saved article or at least I can't find it. If I want to save something to a particular PC I have to copy and paste. Bummer. Also do not know how much cloud space I have - haven't been able to find that either. Always wonder if I am going to run out.

customer_reviews.text: Pocket is fine,and easy to use.I just cant find a list of the items I saved.Folders seems to be a lot easier to navigate.What I get is a group of frameworks that I don't know how to open or find what I have saved
customer_reviews.author: TRAPMAC😅

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Use and Great Articles
customer_reviews.text: First of all, pocket picks great articles. There are always 2-3 things I want to read. Then it is super easy to save them in a pocket and even to tag them with a short title that gives a category I recognize. I'm over 60, not tech savvy and I appreciate everything about Pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Harris

customer_reviews.title: I love this application and service
customer_reviews.text: This app in combination with the different browser plugins, allows you to save articles and webpages for later reading. it reformats the articles for effective and comfortable reading format. this is also good for printing (cuting out ads and more, but saving text and images) you can read the articles on your PC or on the Android and mark them "done". if you hate reading news stories or longer texts from websites - this for you, with a little tweaking it will also sync with your Kindle for the best digital reading experience available today.
customer_reviews.author: Moshe Eshel

customer_reviews.title: No longer works on older Kindle Fire
customer_reviews.text: As of late July 2018, no longer works on first generation Kindle Fire. I get a notice on the Kindle, and it is now listed under my devices that are no longer compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Nuthatch

customer_reviews.title: hey very useful apps
customer_reviews.text: I would have rated this app 5 stars because it's very useful for saving one line articles to read later on offline the only problem is is sometimes the things you save: don't show up on your pocket if they do show up they don't show up in all of their entirety perhaps part of it is the manner in which I use it maybe I just don't know all the tricks and raves to the amp yet leaving still it's an app that has a significant amount of usefulness yeah I highly recommend downloading it
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Essential.
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably wonderful app allows you to send blogs and online reading to your kindle or other device for reading / absorbing at a later time. I also suggest looking into the Chrome extension "Batch Save Pocket" as I was able to save hundreds of my favorite blog's posts to my kindle with just a few clicks.
customer_reviews.author: CorriePritzell

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Even though I got this on FAOTD, I would still have paid the $2.99 for this. This app is great. I have the additional plug-ins installed in Firefox and Chrome so that I can tag something with RIL and read it on any of my computers or on my phone. This is a very convenient app to have installed on your Android phone especially if you like to start reading something on your PC then take it with you to finish up on your phone will commuting home or something. I have used the send to email feature and it worked without any issues as expected. I love this app.
customer_reviews.author: BigDish

customer_reviews.title: Love The Pocket App!
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about the Pocket app. I am constantly storing web pages to read later when I have more time. Best thing is that you can use Pocket with other browsers as well. This app should become standard for all browsers.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Pocket, it's great.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Pocket for years. You can't get a better app to save files in. And, the articles they run are very interesting. I would highly recommend it for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Bill

customer_reviews.title: good for offline reading a webpage
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving it 5 stars as a program because it does do what you want it to. It's great for saving a webpage to read offline.
customer_reviews.author: Loria

customer_reviews.title: I love this app!
customer_reviews.text: I find a great deal of interesting content when browsing the web, and this app is wonderful for saving the items to look at or read later. I also find it a good reference for showing someone an item that is interesting to both of us, and it's really been useful for saving recipes or instructions for making craft items. Some content, such as articles on Facebook for example, may not be saved in their entirety, but there is usually a link to help find it again. I use this app a lot, and have never had a problem with it. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine R. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great for mobile reading
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why they changed the name from Read it Later to Pocket, since the function of this is to save articles online to read later, but I don't hate the name. The transition from computer to phone is amazing, and reading the articles on my phone that I save on my computer almost instantly, in a mobile-reading format, is a great way to be able to quote lines to friends, discuss news and have pages to reference for speeches and conversations.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Buchko Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Still Figuring This Out
customer_reviews.text: My rating is between a four and a five. I like being able to save entire articles and travel information with Pocket. Evernote only lets you save the link. I am guessing that other apps work the same and save either the link or whole article. I just came across Pocket and it worked. I have not been able to organize in files what I save. The filter is by most recent. As I add articles, the list grows longer and more confusing. But for what it does, it works great. We are traveling to Europe and are not sure we will have WiFi all the time. I am using a Kindle Fire HD 8.9".
customer_reviews.author: Gary McCall

customer_reviews.title: Becoming my go to Kindle App
customer_reviews.text: I've tried Evernote, which will only capture URLs not screen shots from Kindles. One Note does not work with Kindles. Pocket allows screen capture and allows access to complete articles without web access. Easy to use, just hit share, and hit pocket. Done. Can use accoss platforms, Android, PC, Kindles. I'm really beginning to appreciate this app, after wasting a lot of time with Springpad, Evernote, and One Note.
customer_reviews.author: Odiewon

customer_reviews.title: I love this app
customer_reviews.text: I love this app! My only problem is the lack of highlighting ability. Many times I just want to highlight a portion of an article or information to store permanently as a reference and it doesn't allow that.
customer_reviews.author: Booklover

customer_reviews.title: always like send you articles about how the job market is ...
customer_reviews.text: You know how your in-laws, parents, etc. always like send you articles about how the job market is dismal when you are unemployed? Well, with Pocket, you can save those and read them later when you aren't buying top ramen with your unemployment check.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: More helpful than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I had been avoiding these type of apps simply because I couldn't see why it's any better than a simple bookmark. Well, it is. Having a repository of locally stored pages is really cool. Having that repository sync to all your devices with Pocket is even cooler. There are currently a couple of information pages that I constantly need to refer to, and having the ability to instantly bring those up on my phone is very convenient. I find myself tagging pages all the time now, very cool!
customer_reviews.author: The King of Nothing

customer_reviews.title: Nice App
customer_reviews.text: Great place to put things to read later. Allows me to make the most of down time.
customer_reviews.author: Yorktown T
